en: You're still young.
Did you really expect him to tell you the truth?
ko: 걔가 진짜 사실대로 말할 줄 알았어?

en: You don't like pop songs, do you?
All you have to do is press the button.
You don't need to flatter your boss.
What do you have in your pocket?
What did you say to Paula?
Do you bowl?
Do you have a lot of pens?
You can't care for pets.
You are a professional, but I am an amateur.
You are very attractive in blue.
Can you make yourself understood in French?
Have you ever been to France?
Do you know Mr. Brown?
Do you usually have tea for breakfast?
After you have taken a rest, you must carry on your study.
ko: 좀 쉬고 나서 공부 계속해야 해.

en: You should not go alone.
Have you ever seen the picture painted by Picasso?
ko: 피카소가 그린 그림 본 적 있어?

en: I hear that you play the piano.
Do you like the piano?
Did you go to Hawaii or Guam?
You've never been to Paris?
What do you have in your bag?
You must show your passport.
Do you go to school by bus or by train?
ko: 학교에 버스 타고 가, 기차 타고 가?

en: Do you go to school by bus?
Do you have a violin?
Can you play the violin?
You may go to the party, but you must be home by midnight.
ko: 파티에 가도 되는데, 자정까지는 집에 와야 해.

en: I hear that you felt ill at ease at the party.
Do you know Noah's ark?
Have you ever been in New York?
What a charming girl you are!
What a beautiful garden you have!
Why do you talk about him as if he were an old man?
How come you're still working?
What do you study a foreign language for?
What kinds of Japanese food do you like?
What results do you anticipate?
You must be courteous to any guest.
ko: 어떤 손님한테든 예의 바르게 행동해야 해.

en: How well can you swim?
How long have you lived in Sasayama?
How long have you played soccer?
Can you tell Tom from his twin brother?
ko: 톰이랑 걔 쌍둥이 형제 구별할 수 있어?

en: Which city are you going to visit first?
ko: 어느 도시를 제일 먼저 갈 거야?

en: What train you are going to take?
To what degree are you interested in baseball?
What papers do you take in?
Which season do you like the best?
What subject do you like best?
How do you assess your students?
How did you solve the problem?
Which club do you want to join?
How long will you stay in Hakone?
How often do you see Tanaka?
How long did you wait?
How long have you been in Kushiro?
How long have you lived in Kobe?
How long did you stay in Canada?
Which CD do you want to listen to?
You are beautifully dressed.
You speak so softly that I cannot quite hear what you say.
ko: 목소리가 너무 작아서 잘 안 들려.

en: You are so kind.
You're looking very well.
You are very rich.
Which box do you like better?
Which way did you choose?
Which group do you want to join?
Where were you going?
Where did you learn English?
You can go wherever you want.
ko: 가고 싶은 곳은 어디든 가도 돼.

en: Where did you see Nancy?
Where do you watch television?
Where do you play tennis?
Where did you see the boy?
Where did you see the woman?
What's your best guess?
How will you earn your daily bread?
How do you come to school?
How did you come by the money?
How did you come by these rare books?
How did you pay for this computer?
Why did you come here this morning?
Why are you alone?
What do you think, Miss West?
Can you speak German?
You can speak German.
Do you watch television?
You can watch television.
Did you watch the soccer game on television?
Did you play tennis?
I hear that you are a good tennis player.
Did you stay home to study for the test?
You have come at an opportune time.
Do you know how to play chess?
You can dance, can't you?
There is no reason for you to feel inferior to anyone.
You're respected by everybody.
You may be right, but we have a slightly different opinion.
ko: 네 말이 맞을 수도 있지만, 우리 생각은 좀 달라.

en: No doubt you will be able to pass the examination.
You had better stop smoking.
You don't smoke, do you?
You had better not smoke so much.
ko: 담배 너무 많이 피우지 않는 게 좋아.

en: You may as well return home at once.
All you have to do is fill in this form.
All you have to do is sit down here and answer the doctor's questions.
ko: 여기 앉아서 의사 선생님 질문에 대답만 하면 돼.

en: Do you have a lot of time?
The more books you read, the more you'll know.
ko: 책을 많이 읽을수록 아는 게 많아질 거야.

en: You did a lot of work in frantic haste.
ko: 너 정말 정신없이 일 많이 했더라.

en: You have a lot of money, and I have none.
ko: 너는 돈이 많지만 나는 하나도 없어.

en: You don't have to talk so loud.
ko: 그렇게 크게 말 안 해도 돼.

en: How did you come by such a big sum of money?
You need not have such fear.
You shouldn't keep them waiting so long.
ko: 그 사람들을 너무 오래 기다리게 하면 안 돼.

en: You don't have to get up so early.
You don't need to go in such a hurry.
You don't have to work so hard.
ko: 그렇게 열심히 일 안 해도 돼.

en: You are generous to give me such a lot of money.
ko: 나한테 이렇게 큰돈을 주다니 정말 너그럽다.

en: You should have kept it secret.
Did you make it for yourself?
You won't have to take charge of that.
ko: 네가 그 일을 맡을 필요는 없을 거야.

en: You're expected to hail it as a triumph.
You can make it.
You should have mentioned it at the outset.
Can you pick it up?
Did you buy it today or yesterday?
ko: 이거 오늘 샀어, 아니면 어제 샀어?

en: You shouldn't miss the opportunity to see it.
You have only to ask for it and it will be given to you.
ko: 그냥 말만 하면 받을 수 있을 거야.

en: You have only to ask for it.
How do you account for that?
And you are going to raise it in three days?
ko: 그걸 삼 일 만에 마련하겠다는 거야?

en: You have only to put them together.
You may choose any of them.
Do you know what it is?
What do you conclude from that?
You had better ask him in advance how much it will cost.
ko: 비용이 얼마나 들지 그 사람한테 미리 물어보는 게 좋겠어.

en: You must refuse to drink this drug.
ko: 이 약 마시는 건 거절해야 해.

en: You must bring home to him the importance of the matter.
ko: 그 사람한테 이 일이 얼마나 중요한지 확실히 깨닫게 해줘야 해.

en: You ought to have read the book.
Do you need the book?
Are you positive of that report?
You are liable for the debt.
You must answer for your careless conduct.
ko: 네 부주의한 행동에 책임을 져야 해.

en: Do you have that bottle?
You ought not to have disclosed the secret.
Did you have a piano lesson that day?
When did you receive the telegram?
Are you in favor of the proposal?
You mustn't swim in the pond.
You should acquaint yourself with the local customs.
Can you open the window?
You may open the window.
You must stand in a line to buy the ticket.
Are you in agreement with the new law?
Do you believe the witness's statement?
You will have guessed its meaning by the end of the chapter.
ko: 챕터 끝날 때쯤이면 무슨 뜻인지 알게 될 거야.

en: You must respond at once to the letter.
You must send the answer to the letter right away.
Are you going to buy the car?
You need to answer the question.
Were you reading a book at that time?
You must make a clean breast of what you saw at that time.
ko: 그때 본 거 다 솔직하게 말해야 돼.

en: Where did you come by the watch?
You must take the fact into consideration.
How do you account for the accident?
What do you have to do with the matter?
You are not to blame for the accident.
You should use the paper bags again and again.
Did you finish the job?
Do you know when the event took place?
You should see the sight.
Are you satisfied with the result?
You've got to answer for the outcome.
You are in favor of the plan, aren't you?
Are you going to take part in the contest?
When did you get through with your engineering problem?
You should keep to the regulations.
You had better make use of this opportunity.
ko: 이번 기회를 잘 활용하는 게 좋겠어.

en: You should have seen the picture.
You had better make use of the opportunity.
ko: 그 기회를 이용하는 게 좋을 거야.

en: You'll find some difficulty carrying out the plan.
ko: 그 계획을 실행하는 게 좀 어려울 거야.

en: You ought to know better than to do such a thing.
ko: 그런 짓을 하면 안 된다는 것쯤은 알아야지.

en: All you have to do is touch the button.
You have only to push the button.
Did you hear the news?
What were you doing at that time?
Were you able to pass the test?
Do you know who brought that team into being?
You are asked to refrain from smoking until the sign is switched off.
ko: 안내등 꺼질 때까지는 담배 피우면 안 돼.

en: You shouldn't say it.
You must view the matter from different angles.
ko: 그 문제를 여러 각도에서 봐야 해.

en: You must talk with him about the matter.
ko: 그 사람이랑 그 일에 대해 얘기해봐야 돼.

en: You may take either of the two books.
ko: 두 권 중에 아무거나 가져가도 돼.

en: You have only to go there.
You don't have to go there.
It is necessary for you to go there.
You had better go there in decent clothes.
ko: 옷 제대로 갖춰 입고 가는 게 좋겠어.

en: Are you going there on business?
You need not go there.
Did you see her there?
You did not say so.
Were you told to do so?
You would be saved a great deal of trouble.
ko: 그러면 고생을 훨씬 덜 수 있을 거야.

en: Do you like sports?
You are a nice boy.
You have been busy.
Can you skate?
You'll soon get used to eating Japanese food.
ko: 곧 일식 먹는 거 익숙해질 거야.

en: You must start soon.
You had better do your homework at once.
You are to see a doctor at once.
You will soon get used to eating Japanese food.
ko: 곧 일본 음식 먹는 거 익숙해질 거야.

en: Did you soon get used to Japanese food?
You'll soon get used to speaking in public.
ko: 사람들 앞에서 말하는 거 곧 익숙해질 거야.

en: You'll soon get accustomed to your new college life.
ko: 새로운 대학 생활에 곧 적응할 거야.

en: You will take to this new job before long.
ko: 머지않아 이 새 일이 좋아질 거야.

en: You ought to finish your homework at once.
You must go at once.
You will be able to speak English soon.
ko: 곧 영어 할 수 있게 될 거야.

en: You had better send for the doctor at once.
You will be able to play tennis better soon.
ko: 곧 테니스 더 잘 치게 될 거야.

en: You'll soon come to enjoy the food and drink here.
ko: 곧 여기 음식들이랑 마실 것들이 좋아질 거야.

en: It is necessary for you to go there immediately.
You have changed quite a lot.
You've improved your English.
You're always disagreeing with your boss.
ko: 넌 항상 상사랑 의견이 안 맞더라.

en: How long have you known Judy?
You are wearing your shirt inside out.
You will soon be able to speak English.
How many of Shakespeare's tragedies have you read?
You have just won a prize of $5000 in a California state safety competition for proper use of your seatbelt.
ko: 안전벨트 잘 매서 캘리포니아 주 안전 경연 대회 상금 5000달러를 방금 탔어.

en: Do you like San Francisco?
Do you play soccer?
Are you familiar with the rules of soccer?
You must make your parents happy.
You will be shocked to hear this.
You must not give way to those demands.
Do you make friends with these boys?
Are you for or against this?
Which will you take, this one or that one?
Which do you like better, this or that?
ko: 이게 더 좋아, 저게 더 좋아?

en: Do you know what this is?
You don't play golf, do you?
If you take this medicine, you'll feel better.
ko: 이 약 먹으면 좀 나아질 거야.

en: You should confer with your attorney on this matter.
You may read this book.
You are not to sleep in this room.
You reach him by calling this number.
ko: 이 번호로 전화하면 그 사람이랑 연락될 거야.

en: Did you write this fairy tale by yourself?
You can search for his number in this telephone book.
ko: 이 전화번호부에서 그 사람 번호 찾을 수 있어요.

en: You are very fond of the lunch menu of this restaurant.
ko: 이 식당 점심 메뉴 진짜 좋아하시네요.

en: You should apologize to Mrs. Smith for your rude behavior the other night.
ko: 저번에 무례하게 행동한 거 스미스 씨 부인한테 사과해야 해요.

en: You are not allowed to use this car.
Are you going to pay a visit to China this fall?
You will have seen this photograph somewhere.
ko: 이 사진 어디선가 본 적 있을 거예요.

en: You don't have to answer this question.
ko: 이 질문엔 대답 안 해도 돼요.

en: Do you want this watch mended?
How do you account for this situation?
How do you account for this fact?
What do you have to do with this matter?
Had you seen snow before you came to this town?
ko: 이 동네 오기 전에 눈 본 적 있어요?

en: You're not an expert at this job any more than I am.
ko: 이 일에 있어서는 저나 그쪽이나 전문가 아닌 건 마찬가지예요.

en: Have you read this article?
You can't apply this rule to every case.
ko: 이 규칙을 모든 경우에 다 적용할 수는 없어요.

en: Are you the owner of this house?
By whom did you get this English composition corrected?
You have only to push this button.
Do you want this present delivered?
Since you're a member of this sports club, you'll have to conform to its rules.
ko: 이 스포츠 클럽 회원이니까 규칙을 따라야 해요.

en: You look your best in this suit.
I suggest you keep out of this.
ko: 이 일에는 안 끼어드는 게 좋겠어요.

en: Do you have something to do with this group?
Do you know how to use this camera?
Have you ever heard this opera sung in Italian?
ko: 이 오페라 이탈리아어로 부르는 거 들어본 적 있어요?

en: You've made remarkable progress in English in the past year.
ko: 지난 1년 동안 영어 실력이 진짜 많이 늘었네요.

en: You haven't mentioned cost, and I won't sign until I know the bottom line.
ko: 비용 얘기는 안 하셨는데, 최종 금액을 알기 전까지는 사인 안 할게요.

en: You do not have to come here.
Are you a teacher here or a student?
You would do well to stay here.
Now that you are here, you can help do the cleaning.
ko: 여기 온 김에 청소 좀 도와줘요.

en: You may as well start at once as stay here.
ko: 여기 있느니 그냥 지금 바로 시작하는 게 낫겠어요.

en: You have only to wait here.
You shouldn't eat here.
You don't run here.
You can not swim here.
You drink too much coffee.
You must be Miss Kenny.
You are far from a careful driver.
You should have Mr Green correct your English pronunciation.
ko: 그린 씨한테 영어 발음 교정 좀 받아보세요.

en: Do you care for classical music?
You are a pretty girl.
Have you heard of a bird called the Arctic Tern?
Did you go straight home after school yesterday?
ko: 어제 학교 끝나고 바로 집에 갔어요?

en: What did you do yesterday?
I believe that you will succeed.
Have you ever learned how to play the guitar?
ko: 기타 치는 법 배운 적 있어요?

en: You ought to be ashamed to cheat on exams.
ko: 시험에서 부정행위 하다니 부끄러운 줄 알아야 해요.

en: You do your best to put such thoughts out of his head.
ko: 그 사람 머릿속에서 그런 생각들을 지울 수 있게 최선을 다해 보세요.

en: Not only you but also I am in the wrong.
What did you do with your camera?
You've made a good many mistakes.
Did you call your friend in Canada?
You need not stand up.
You take after your mother. You remind me of her.
You must help your mother.
You speak like your mother.
You look just like your mother.
Do you remember your father's birthday?
You had better help your father.
Are you going to write to your father?
Can you do with a light meal for lunch?
Do you like tea or coffee?
You are nodding over your work.
Do you think he is dead?
What do you do in your spare time?
You should be more careful with your money.
You should get your eyes examined by the doctor.
You know many interesting places, don't you?
Do you know which of okra and natto is more gooey?
ko: 오크라랑 낫토 중에 뭐가 더 끈적거리는지 알아?

en: Do you mean to do without an overcoat?
Do you come from Austria or Australia?
Were you younger than Ellen?
You are welcomed in our class.
You were flat on your back for two weeks with influenza.
You must write your name in ink.
You might avoid an unpleasant experience.
ko: 기분 나쁜 일은 피할 수도 있을 거야.

en: When are you busy?
When do you study?
When did you see him?
When do you go back to Japan?
When will you go back to Japan?
When did you come back from Tokyo?
When do you run?
When did you finish writing the letter?
When are you going to call me?
When do you come and see me?
When do you start for Sado?
When will you come back to school?
When did you get home?
You may fall ill at any moment.
You're always complaining!
You are always complaining about your husband.
You always called me from her house.
ko: 너 항상 걔네 집에서 나한테 전화했잖아.

en: You always reserve the same room.
Do you always have coffee with your breakfast?
ko: 아침 먹을 때 항상 커피 마셔?

en: You are always late.
You should always tell the truth.
You don't have to be perfect all the time.
What time do you usually turn in?
When do you practice the piano?
When did you visit New York?
You will be welcome at any time.
When are you going to quit smoking?
When did you finish the work?
When did you finish writing the report?
When did you begin playing golf?
When are you to leave here?
You will always be welcome whenever you come.
You will know the truth one day.
How long have you been busy?
How long have you studied?
How long have you lived in Sanda?
You will be sorry for it some day.
How many rooms do you have?
How many apples do you want?
You differ from me in some ways.
Do you have any apples?
Do you have a part time job?
Can you tell the difference between an American and a Canadian?
ko: 미국 사람이랑 캐나다 사람 구분할 수 있어요?

en: Are you American or French?
Would you like to visit the United States?
You are an American boy.
I hear that you are going to the United States.
You will miss Japanese food in the United States.
ko: 미국에 가면 일본 음식이 그리울 거예요.

en: Do you think we should import rice from the U.S.?
You had better not sit up late up night.
You are all too quick.
You look at that tree.
You didn't seem to want that book.
ko: 그 책을 별로 안 원하시는 것 같더라고요.

en: You look nice in that red sweater.
Do you think that dress suits her?
ko: 그 드레스가 그녀한테 잘 어울리는 것 같아요?

en: Can you see that small house?
What did you do with that car?
Do you know that crying boy?
Do you have something to do with that company?
You must have been surprised to meet your teacher in such a place.
ko: 그런 곳에서 선생님을 만나다니 정말 놀랐겠어요.

en: Do you intend to join that tennis club?
You had better consult with your teacher.
You must accept the king of Spain as your leader.
You may come to regret having told him about your plan.
ko: 그 사람한테 계획을 말한 걸 후회하게 될지도 몰라요.

en: Are you going to go to Tokyo tomorrow?
Do you think it will be fine tomorrow?
You always bandy words with me: you never listen to me.
ko: 항상 말대답만 하시고 제 말은 전혀 안 들으시네요.

en: Do you believe in UFOs?
You should be back by 9 o'clock.
You can hear the news on the radio at nine o'clock.
You should arrive at school before eight.
Have you ever returned home before seven?
You must get up at six.
You should start between six and seven.
You came at five.
You have three pens.
You have four dogs.
You have two flowers.
Have you been studying for two hours?
You have never been to Okinawa, have you?
ko: 너 오키나와 한 번도 안 가봤지?

en: How many books do you read a month?
ko: 너 한 달에 책 몇 권 읽어?

en: Have you known her since 1990?
You should know better now you are eighteen.
Are you going to carry on your work until ten?
Were you home at ten?
How would you define "happiness"?
You neglected to say "Thank you."
You should turn in your paper by next Saturday.
ko: 다음 주 토요일까지 과제 내야 해.

en: Did you accomplish your purpose?
Do you like to study?
You must keep in mind that she's much younger than you.
ko: 걔가 너보다 훨씬 어리다는 걸 명심해야 해.

en: You have only to ask him if he'd like to join us.
ko: 걔한테 우리랑 같이 갈 건지 물어보기만 하면 돼.

en: Do you know his birthplace?
Do you remember the town where he was born?
You may give this picture to whoever wants it.
ko: 이 사진 갖고 싶은 사람 아무나 줘도 돼.

en: You bought the ticket for the train?
You had better go to bed early.
You see everything in terms of money.
Are you a believer?
You cannot climb!
You must hold up your hands.
You have to protect your family.
Are you a student of a private high school?
You think I have nothing to do; but on the contrary, I am very busy.
ko: 내가 할 일 없는 줄 아나 본데, 사실 나 엄청 바빠.

en: Did you use my camera?
Do you want me to make coffee?
You've sure got a short fuse today.
Did you carry out your plan?
What time do you go home?
You must study your whole life.
Do you use a word processor?
Do you take part in any community activities?
ko: 지역 사회 활동 같은 거 해?

en: No matter how capable you are, you're not going to get a promotion.
ko: 네가 아무리 유능해도 승진은 못 할 거야.

en: Do you have a hobby - for example, painting?
As soon as you have done that, I would like you to start preparing supper.
ko: 그거 다 하면 바로 저녁 준비 좀 해줘.

en: You shall see greater things than that.
ko: 그것보다 더 대단한 걸 보게 될 거야.

en: You should keep in touch with Mr Smith.
ko: 스미스 씨랑 계속 연락하고 지내야 해.

en: Have you ever heard her sing on the stage?
ko: 걔가 무대에서 노래하는 거 들어본 적 있어?

en: You must consider this problem as a whole.
You are both pretty and kind.
You say one thing and then act just the opposite.
ko: 넌 말하는 거랑 행동하는 게 정반대야.

en: Did you read that thick book?
Are you satisfied with your job?
Remembering when I dreamed in your arms.
ko: 네 품 안에서 꿈꾸던 때가 생각나.

en: I didn't mean to eavesdrop on your talk.
Go on with your story. That is so interesting!
Tell me your story. I am all ears.
ko: 얘기 좀 해줘. 다 듣고 있어.

en: I can't possibly think your story is true.
ko: 네 말이 사실이라고는 도저히 못 믿겠어.

en: Your speech was far from satisfactory.
I can't follow you.
Your story doesn't square with the facts.
You have a very crisp way of speaking.
ko: 너 말 되게 똑 부러지게 한다.

en: I doubt your good sense.
Do your parents agree to your becoming a flight attendant?
ko: 부모님이 너 승무원 되는 거 찬성하셔?

en: Your parents kept an eye on us.
If your parents heard of your success, they would be proud of you.
ko: 부모님이 네 성공 소식 들으시면 정말 자랑스러워하실 거야.

en: I'll look after your child while you are away.
ko: 너 없는 동안 내가 애기 봐줄게.

en: A Mr Jones came while you were out.
ko: 너 없을 때 존스라는 분이 오셨어.

en: I can understand your position perfectly.
I would like to hear your honest opinion.
I wouldn't go so far as to say your theory is completely wrong.
ko: 네 이론이 완전히 틀렸다고까지는 말 안 할게.

en: I will give you whatever you want.
ko: 네가 원하는 건 뭐든 다 줄게.

en: Your summary leaves nothing to be desired.
I cannot answer your request offhand.
ko: 네 요청에 지금 바로 대답해 주기는 좀 힘들어.

en: Your account is empty.
We'll take care of reconfirmation of your reservation.
I'm sorry I opened your mail by mistake.
Is anyone coming besides your friends?
What time did your friend go home?
ko: 네 친구 몇 시에 집에 갔어?

en: When did your friend leave for America?
Say hello to your friends.
If your friend reminds you kindly of your faults, take what he says not only pleasantly, but thankfully.
ko: 친구가 네 잘못을 친절하게 지적해주면 기분 좋게, 그리고 고맙게 받아들여.

en: I am filled with admiration for your bravery.
I bow to your superior judgement.
Compare your translation with his.
ko: 네 번역이랑 그 사람 거랑 비교해봐.

en: I appreciate your problem.
Come and write your name.
Please write down your name.
Tell me what your name is.
Your name stands first in the list.
ko: 네 이름이 명단 맨 위에 있어.

en: Your name was dropped from the list.
How do you pronounce your name?
Spell your name, please.
May I ask you some questions about your name?
ko: 네 이름에 대해서 몇 가지 물어봐도 돼?

en: I will write down your name and address.
Write your name and address.
Fill in your name and address.
Your name was mentioned.
Your name is taped on the case.
How do you spell your family name?
When did your daughter come of age?
The day will surely come when your dreams will come true.
ko: 네 꿈이 이루어질 날이 꼭 올 거야.

en: Your dream will come true in the near future.
Your dreams have come true.
May all your dreams come true!
ko: 네 모든 꿈이 다 이루어지길 바라!

en: Your pulse is normal.
To your future!
Your sister is the most diligent of all my friends.
ko: 내 친구들 중에서 네 여동생이 제일 성실해.

en: Your sister can not speak English.
Is your sister swimming in the river?
I'd like to see your sister.
That sister of yours is always complaining of her husband.
ko: 네 여동생은 맨날 남편 흉만 보더라.

en: Who does your sister take after?
Listen to me carefully with your book closed.
ko: 책 덮고 내 말 잘 들어봐.

en: Will you lend me your book?
ko: 네 책 좀 빌려줄 수 있어?

en: Lend me your book, please.
Please lend me your book.
Please take your book off this table.
ko: 이 테이블에서 네 책 좀 치워줘.

en: When is your book coming out?
Here is your book.
What is the acreage of your ranch?
I hope your wish will come true.
May all your wishes come true!
Your hat is similar to mine.
Your hat matches your dress marvellously.
ko: 네 모자 옷이랑 진짜 잘 어울린다.

en: Your visit has cheered him.
I've looked through your report and made some notes on it.
ko: 네 보고서 훑어보고 메모 좀 남겨뒀어.

en: There are a few mistakes in your report.
ko: 네 보고서에 실수가 몇 개 있더라.

en: There are few mistakes in your report.
What is your mother tongue?
Your answer almost amounts to a threat.
Please forgive me for not answering your letter.
ko: 답장 못 해서 미안해, 좀 봐줘.

en: Your dress is already out of fashion.
You're a month behind in your rent.
Did you clean your room?
Where is your room?
I never thought of coming to your place.
ko: 네 집에 오게 될 줄은 생각도 못 했어.

en: Are there two windows in your room?
I'm looking forward to seeing your father.
ko: 너희 아버님 뵙는 거 기대하고 있어.

en: If I had known about your illness, I could have visited you in the hospital.
ko: 너 아픈 거 알았으면 병문안 갔을 텐데.

en: I hope you'll get well soon.
I perceive by your face that you have good news.
ko: 얼굴 보니까 좋은 소식 있나 보네.

en: Your handwriting is similar to mine.
What time is your plane due to take off?
What time does your plane depart?
Your comments were always very helpful to me.
ko: 네 조언이 항상 나한테 큰 도움이 됐어.

en: It's your turn. Please come this way.
You are correct in your judgement.
What long hair you've got!
Your hair needs cutting.
Your remark is irrelevant to our argument.
What does your remark have to do with the subject we are talking about?
ko: 네 말이 지금 우리 주제랑 무슨 상관이야?

en: Your pronunciation is more or less correct.
Write the date of your birth.
I feel like I'm being drawn into your eyes.
ko: 네 눈 속으로 빨려 들어가는 것 같아.

en: We deplore your cruelty to animals.
ko: 동물 학대하는 건 정말 너무한 것 같아요.

en: You will be paid according as you work.
Your headache comes from overwork.
Compare your paper with the model one.
ko: 네 답안지를 모범 답안이랑 비교해 봐.

en: Your paper contains too many mistakes.
ko: 네 답안지에 틀린 게 너무 많아.

en: Your answer is not to the point.
Your answer doesn't make sense.
Your answer differs from mine.
Your answer is correct.
I'm not saying that your answers are always wrong.
ko: 네 답이 항상 틀렸다는 건 아니야.

en: Let's check your boarding pass.
Did your efforts come to much?
Your effort deserves praise.
Your efforts resulted in the success.
Please call on me when it is convenient for you.
Could you please re-schedule the meeting at your convenience?
ko: 편하신 시간으로 회의 일정 다시 잡아주실 수 있나요?

en: Please come to meet me some time when it's convenient.
Your proposal is worthy of being considered.
Your suggestion seems irrelevant to our discussion here.
ko: 네 제안은 지금 우리 얘기랑 상관없는 것 같아.

en: Your suggestion seems reasonable.
ko: 네 제안은 꽤 합리적인 것 같아.

en: I'm all for your suggestion.
It has not yet been decided whether to approve of your proposal.
ko: 네 제안을 승인할지는 아직 안 정해졌어.

en: Stop playing tricks on your brother.
Your subscription expires with the June issue.
Can you show me any evidence for your statement?
I interpreted your silence as consent.
ko: 아무 말 없길래 동의하는 줄 알았어.

en: What are your strong points?
I can spot you from a distance with your long, white hair.
ko: 긴 흰머리 때문에 멀리서도 딱 보이더라.

en: I look forward to seeing you on my next trip to your city.
ko: 다음에 그쪽 동네 갈 때 만나는 거 기대하고 있을게.

en: I wish I had listened to your advice.
Your advice will have no effect on them.
ko: 네 조언은 걔들한테 아무 소용 없을 거야.

en: I daresay your advice will have its effect on them.
ko: 내 생각엔 네 조언이 분명히 효과가 있을 거야.

en: Thanks to your advice, I got over the hardship.
ko: 네 조언 덕분에 힘든 시기를 잘 넘겼어.

en: Without your advice, I would have been at a loss.
ko: 네 조언이 없었으면 정말 막막했을 거야.

en: Acting on your advice, I've decided to exercise more regularly.
ko: 네 조언대로 운동을 더 규칙적으로 하기로 했어.

en: If it were not for your advice I would fail.
ko: 네 조언이 없었다면 난 실패했을 거야.

en: If it had not been for your advice, I could not have succeeded.
ko: 네 조언이 아니었다면 성공하지 못했을 거야.

en: Had it not been for your advice he would have been ruined.
ko: 네 조언이 없었더라면 그는 망했을 거야.

en: I bought a pen for your birthday present.
Who is your favorite actor?
I will go to see him instead of you.
ko: 내가 너 대신 그 사람 만나러 갈게.

en: Shall I answer this letter for you?
ko: 너 대신 이 편지에 답장해 줄까?

en: I will compensate you for your loss.
You are rude.
You should have your son independent of you.
What does your son want to be when he grows up?
ko: 아드님은 나중에 커서 뭐가 되고 싶대요?

en: It won't be your fault if your son does anything wrong: he is twenty-five now, isn't he?
ko: 아들이 잘못한다고 해도 네 탓이 아니야. 이제 스물다섯 살이잖아, 그치?

en: The address you are looking for is within a stone's throw of the city hall.
Who sings the best of all the boys in your class?
ko: 우리 반 남자애들 중에 누가 노래 제일 잘해요?

en: Don't forget to give my best regards to your lovely wife.
ko: 사모님께 안부 전해주는 거 잊지 마세요.

en: Do you know your forefather?
Your goodwill sank into my heart.
Look at the sign just ahead of you.
ko: 바로 앞에 있는 표지판 좀 보세요.

en: Your shipment should be delivered within twenty four hours.
Your explanation is too abstract to me.
Please show me your stamp album.
Don't leave your baby crying.
Is your baby sleeping?
I didn't think this was your seat.
I misplaced your blue pen.
ko: 파란색 펜을 어디다 잘못 뒀나 봐요.

en: Your voice reminds me of my late grandmother.
ko: 목소리 들으니까 돌아가신 할머니 생각이 나요.

en: I am happy to hear your voice.
I would like to hear your voice, too.
Your voice reminds me of your mother.
Your student called me.
Your students have given us new hope.
I hope for your success.
I am delighted at your success.
How do you pronounce your last name?
Please allow me to measure you.
I didn't catch your last name.
I can't thank you enough for your kindness.
ko: 친절을 베풀어 주셔서 뭐라 감사드려야 할지 모르겠어요.

en: Your guess is quite wrong.
Your guess is wrong.
Your prompt reply is urgently required.
What is your ultimate goal in your life?
I don't care about your race or age or religion.
ko: 인종이나 나이, 종교 같은 건 상관없어요.

en: One of the greatest dangers in your human relations is self-centeredness.
ko: 인간관계에서 제일 위험한 것 중 하나가 자기중심적인 태도예요.

en: How tall are you, and how much do you weigh?
I will never forget your kindness.
ko: 베풀어 주신 친절 절대 잊지 않을게요.

en: You were so nice to me, and I had a really pleasant trip. Thanks so much.
ko: 정말 잘해주셔서 덕분에 즐겁게 여행했어요. 진짜 감사해요.

en: I am much obliged to you for your kindness.
We're very grateful for your hospitality.
I'll treasure your kind words.
I'm willing to accept your offer.
I'll accept your offer.
I'll give you our answer after we go into your proposal in greater detail.
ko: 제안하신 내용을 좀 더 자세히 검토해 본 뒤에 답변 드릴게요.

en: I am willing to take your offer.
Your new car looks awfully expensive to me.
ko: 새로 산 차가 엄청 비싸 보이네요.

en: I cannot help admiring your new car.
ko: 새 차가 정말 멋져서 감탄이 절로 나오네요.

en: Could you enlarge on your new theory?
ko: 그 새로운 이론에 대해 좀 더 자세히 설명해 주실 수 있나요?

en: Your new friends may laugh at some of the things you do.
ko: 새로 사귄 친구들이 당신이 하는 행동을 보고 웃을지도 몰라요.

en: I just adore your new hat.
I have to put down your new address.
Let me know your new address.
Is your new car behaving well?
You had better supplement your diet with vitamins.
ko: 비타민으로 영양을 좀 보충하는 게 좋겠어요.

en: No matter what your profession, or how happy you may be in it, there are moments when you wish you had chosen some other career.
ko: 어떤 직업을 가졌든, 그 일에 얼마나 만족하든 가끔은 다른 길을 선택했더라면 하고 생각할 때가 있죠.

en: Your analysis of the situation is accurate.
Your train leaves from Platform 10.
What flight were you on?
How do you like your boss's plan?
If your boss "sacks" you, it means you're fired.
How old is your elder son?
Your detailed explanation of the situation has let me see the light.
ko: 상황을 자세히 설명해 주셔서 이제야 좀 알겠네요.

en: I am sure your promotion was timely and well deserved.
ko: 이번에 제때 승진하신 거 정말 당연한 결과라고 생각해요.

en: Can I be of any assistance to you?
If it had not been for your help, he would have been ruined.
I deeply appreciate your advice and kindness.
ko: 조언해 주시고 친절하게 대해 주셔서 정말 감사해요.

en: We do need your advice.
But for your help I could not have got over the hardship.
ko: 도움 없었으면 이 고생을 이겨내지 못했을 거예요.

en: But for your help, I would have failed.
But for your help, we should not have finished in time.
ko: 도움 없었으면 제시간에 못 끝냈을 거예요.

en: If it were not for your help, I could not have succeeded.
What are you going to do with your first pay?
ko: 첫 월급 타면 뭐 할 거예요?

en: Let's leave when you are ready.
I will see to it that everything is ready for your departure.
ko: 출발하시는 데 차질 없게 제가 다 준비해 놓을게요.

en: What should we do with this white elephant your aunt gave us? It's way too ugly to go on the wall.
ko: 이모가 주신 이 애물단지 어쩌죠? 벽에 걸기엔 너무 못생겼는데.

en: I want to talk with your uncle.
Let me know your address.
Don't read evil intentions into the ordinary actions of people around you.
ko: 주변 사람들의 평범한 행동을 너무 삐딱하게 보지 마세요.

en: Your job hangs by a thread.
Tell me what your hobby is.
Please tell me about your hobbies.
If it had not been for your help, I might have failed.
Your letter crossed mine.
I think your letter is under that book.
ko: 보내신 편지가 저 책 밑에 있는 것 같아요.

en: It was careless of me to forget to answer your letter.
ko: 답장하는 걸 깜빡하다니 제가 너무 부주의했네요.

en: Your hands need washing.
Would you mind my moving your car?
Would you mind if I used your car?
This car of yours is a real gas guzzler.
ko: 이 차 완전 기름 먹는 하마네요.

en: Your car exceeded the speed limit.
Your car handles easily.
Your car is three times as big as this one.
ko: 차가 이것보다 세 배는 더 크네요.

en: Your car was washed by Ken.
I will make up for the damage I did to your car.
May I take a picture of you?
Show your photograph.
Can I keep one of your pictures?
Your question is very hard to answer.
Your question is hard to answer.
It is a matter of principle with him to answer your questions honestly.
ko: 질문에 정직하게 대답하는 게 그 사람 원칙이에요.

en: Lend me your dictionary, please.
Will you lend your dictionary to me?
Can I use your dictionary?
I've had enough of your boasts.
Can you account for your car accident?
ko: 너 교통사고 난 거 설명할 수 있어?

en: Lend me your bicycle.
Your bicycle is better than mine.
You will find your bicycle somewhere in the neighborhood of the station.
ko: 역 근처 어디선가 네 자전거 찾을 수 있을 거야.

en: After you with the salt.
Your watch is superior in quality to mine.
ko: 네 시계가 내 것보다 훨씬 좋아.

en: I will have repaired your watch by tomorrow.
Your watch is on the desk.
Your watch has been found.
Does your watch keep good time?
Try to make good use of your time.
Shall I come to your office?
A 10% tax will be withheld from the payment to you.
ko: 네 지급액에서 세금 10%가 원천 징수될 거야.

en: I'll do it according to your instructions.
It was my book that your child tore to pieces.
ko: 네 애가 갈갈이 찢어놓은 거 내 책이야.

en: What's your older sister doing now?
Your sister is a good pianist, isn't she?
ko: 네 언니 피아노 진짜 잘 치지, 그치?

en: I want the same dictionary that your sister has.
ko: 나도 네 언니가 가진 거랑 똑같은 사전 갖고 싶어.

en: You've finished your work.
I'm afraid the job I've got for you won't be easy.
ko: 내가 너한테 줄 일이 쉽지 않을 것 같아 걱정이야.

en: Your work is not altogether satisfactory.
Your work is far from being satisfactory.
Let me help you to do the work.
ko: 내가 그 일 하는 거 도와줄게.

en: You won't succeed unless you attend to your work.
ko: 네 일에 집중 안 하면 성공 못 할 거야.

en: Just go about your business and don't keep looking at me.
ko: 그냥 네 일이나 해, 자꾸 나 쳐다보지 말고.

en: We will meet after you have finished your work.
I will carry it out if you agree to our plan.
ko: 네가 우리 계획에 찬성하면 내가 실행에 옮길게.

en: May I accompany you on your walk?
We encourage your participation.
Can I borrow your umbrella?
ko: 네 우산 좀 빌려줄 수 있어?

en: Your composition is not altogether bad.
Your composition is far from perfect.
There are few, if any, errors in your composition.
ko: 네 작문에는 틀린 게 거의 없어.

en: Would you show us some samples of your work?
ko: 네 작업물 샘플 좀 보여줄 수 있어?

en: Let me sample your cake.
ko: 네 케이크 맛 좀 봐도 돼?

en: Your purse is similar to mine.
Your wallet is on the television set.
We are counting on you for financial help.
ko: 우리는 네가 재정적으로 도와줄 거라고 믿고 있어.

en: It's much cheaper to live on grains and vegetables you can grow in your garden.
ko: 정원에서 직접 기른 곡물이랑 채소 먹고 사는 게 훨씬 저렴해.

en: I would like to get your latest catalogue.
ko: 네 최신 카탈로그 좀 받고 싶어.

en: Do you have a recent photo of yourself?
Your left eye is congested.
You'll see the store on your left.
Tell me something about your country.
Do you have much snow in your country?
Do you eat seaweed in your country?
Do people drink tea in your country?
Your conduct allows of no excuse.
Your behavior does not come up to my expectations.
ko: 네 행동이 내 기대에 못 미쳐.

en: We ask you to account for your conduct.
I will follow you wherever you go.
ko: 네가 어디를 가든 난 따라갈 거야.

en: Your conduct gave rise to another problem.
ko: 네 행동 때문에 또 다른 문제가 생겼어.

en: I really agree with what you're saying.
Please tell me what you think.
Your idea is similar to mine.
Your ideas are in accord with ours.
Your ideas are hardly practical.
Your ideas are all out of date.
Your idea is, as it were, a castle in the air.
ko: 네 아이디어는 말하자면 뜬구름 잡는 소리야.

en: I don't know your preference, so please help yourself.
ko: 네 취향을 모르니까 마음껏 골라 봐.

en: You may choose any book you like.
ko: 네가 좋아하는 책 아무거나 골라도 돼.

en: You may give the ticket to whomever you like.
ko: 네가 주고 싶은 사람 아무한테나 티켓 줘도 돼.

en: What's your favorite food?
Who is your favorite composer?
Who is your favorite author?
You can spend your time in any way you want; it's your time, after all.
You can have any you want.
What is your favorite TV program?
I'll buy you whatever clothes you want.
I am very pleased to hear of your success.
We are grateful to you for your help.
Please close the door behind you.
He is always at your back.
After you with the pepper.
ko: 후추 다 쓰고 나면 나 좀 줄래?

en: Judging from what you say, he must be a great writer.
ko: 네 말을 들어보니 그 사람 대단한 작가인가 보네.

en: Don't you think you're putting the cart before the horse?
ko: 너 지금 앞뒤가 바뀐 거 아니야?

en: What you are saying is absolutely wrong.
I don't understand what you are talking about.
ko: 네가 무슨 말을 하는 건지 모르겠어.

en: Your remarks were out of place.
ko: 네 말은 상황에 좀 안 맞았어.

en: What you said is not true.
What you said is, in a sense, true.
What you said is right in a sense, but it made her angry.
ko: 네 말이 어느 정도는 맞지만, 그것 때문에 그 애가 화났어.

en: Your remarks were rather out of place.
I can't fathom what you said.
ko: 네가 무슨 소리를 하는 건지 도무지 모르겠어.

en: I guess you're right, Jane.
ko: 제인, 네 말이 맞는 것 같아.

en: Granting that you are right, we still can't approve of your plan.
ko: 네 말이 맞다고 쳐도, 네 계획은 찬성할 수 없어.

en: Maybe you're right.
You may be right about that.
ko: 그 점에 대해서는 네 말이 맞을 수도 있어.

en: Admitting what you say, I still think he is wrong.
ko: 네 말은 인정하지만, 그래도 난 그 사람이 틀렸다고 생각해.

en: While I see what you say, I can't agree with you.
ko: 무슨 말인지 알겠는데, 난 동의 못 해.

en: I cannot agree with you on the matter.
ko: 그 문제에 대해서는 동의할 수 없어.

en: I cannot follow you.
We will check to see if what you have said is really the truth.
ko: 네 말이 정말 사실인지 확인해 볼게.

en: I understand what you mean.
Accepting what you say, I'm still against the project.
ko: 네 말은 알겠는데, 난 여전히 그 프로젝트 반대야.

en: You could be right, I suppose.
ko: 아마 네 말이 맞을 수도 있겠다.

en: It is difficult to believe what you say.
What you say does not make any sense to me.
ko: 네 말은 전혀 말이 안 돼.

en: What you say is true in a sense.
I can not but admit the truth of your remarks.
ko: 네 말이 사실이라는 걸 인정할 수밖에 없네.

en: Could you tell me your present address?
Please tell me your present address.
Your views are quite opposite to mine.
Your research will surely bear fruit.
ko: 연구하신 거 꼭 좋은 결과 있을 거예요.

en: Your dog is big and mine is small.
ko: 그쪽 강아지는 큰데 제 건 작아요.

en: Your dog always barks at me.
I'm not trying to deprive you of your rights.
I am anxious about your health.
What's your blood group?
I'm really pleased at the news of your marriage.
There are few but admire your resolution.
ko: 그쪽 결심을 칭찬하지 않는 사람이 없어요.

en: Even your faults do not lessen my respect for you, and in friendship this is what counts.
ko: 단점이 있어도 존경하는 마음은 변하지 않아요. 친구 사이에 그게 중요하죠.

en: Your words of encouragement meant a lot to me.
ko: 응원해 주신 말이 저한테 큰 힘이 됐어요.

en: Without your encouragement, I should have given up the plan.
ko: 응원 안 해주셨으면 계획 포기했을 거예요.

en: A favorable review of your play will appear in the next issue.
ko: 다음 호에 연극에 대한 호평이 실릴 거예요.

en: Your plan must fit in with mine.
ko: 계획이 제 거랑 잘 맞아야 할 텐데요.

en: Tell me all about your plan.
Your plan is a good one, but mine is a better one.
ko: 그쪽 계획도 좋지만 제 게 더 나은 것 같아요.

en: Your plan requires a large amount of money.
ko: 그 계획은 돈이 꽤 많이 들겠는데요.

en: Your plan has the virtue of being practical.
Your plan is not in line with our policy.
ko: 그 계획은 저희 정책이랑 안 맞아요.

en: Your plan is sure to succeed.
I agree to your plan.
I want to be in your plan.
I will not object to your plan.
I'm all for your plan.
I can't keep pace with your plan.
You cannot depend on his support for your project.
ko: 그 사람 도움은 기대 안 하시는 게 좋아요.

en: I hope your plan will work out.
May we know your bank account?
ko: 계좌 번호 좀 알 수 있을까요?

en: Read such books as interest you.
Should I have asked your permission?
Is your salary adequate to support your family?
Is your salary keeping up with inflation?
You will be paid a stable base salary plus commissions on sale.
ko: 기본급에 판매 수당이 추가로 붙을 거예요.

en: You should try to conquer your smoking habit.
Your argument came across well.
Your duty is to support your family.
If it weren't for your invaluable help, everything would be ruined.
ko: 도와주지 않으셨으면 다 엉망이 됐을 거예요.

en: Your prayer will be answered.
I know exactly how you feel.
Could I use your desk?
Your gift will go far towards helping to build the children's hospital.
ko: 보내주신 선물이 어린이 병원을 짓는 데 큰 도움이 될 거예요.

en: Attach a recent photograph to your application form.
Please give me your picture lest I forget how you look.
ko: 얼굴 잊어버리지 않게 사진 한 장 주세요.

en: I didn't mean to hurt your feelings.
Shall I carry your bag?
Which is your bag?
Your college years will soon come to an end.
I want to know more about your school life.
I am looking forward to visiting your school.
ko: 네 학교 가는 거 정말 기대돼.

en: Is your school in this town?
Is your school far from here?
How many students are there in your school?
Could you tell me something about your school?
Does every boy have to learn cooking in your school?
ko: 네 학교는 남자애들도 다 요리 배워야 돼?

en: Is Japanese taught in your school now?
How many people live in your town?
Your answer is anything but satisfactory to us.
ko: 네 대답은 우리한테 전혀 만족스럽지 않아.

en: Don't lay your fault at my door.
ko: 네 잘못을 내 탓으로 돌리지 마.

en: Let me relieve you of your baggage.
It looks like your luggage is on the next flight.
ko: 네 짐 다음 비행기에 있는 것 같아.

en: Do you only have this bag with you?
It's your turn to sing.
Please write about your home.
Your family must be very nice.
ko: 네 가족들은 정말 좋은 분들일 거야.

en: We are all looking forward to seeing your family.
ko: 우리 다 네 가족들 만나는 거 기대하고 있어.

en: I had no difficulty finding your house.
ko: 네 집 찾는 거 전혀 안 어려웠어.

en: Zeal for your house will consume me.
ko: 네 집을 향한 내 열정이 넘쳐나.

en: Your house needs painting.
Your house has a very cozy atmosphere.
Whose house is opposite to yours?
I'll pick you up at your home.
How about your place?
How long does it take you to get here from your house by train?
ko: 네 집에서 여기까지 기차로 얼마나 걸려?

en: How many rooms are there on the second floor of your house?
ko: 네 집 2층에 방 몇 개 있어?

en: Your wife ought to tell you all about it.
ko: 네 아내가 너한테 그거 다 말해줘야 할 텐데.

en: Will you lend me your pencil?
Could I use your pencil?
Your assistance is indispensable for us.
Thanks to your help, we were successful.
I'm very grateful for your help.
I'd appreciate your help.
Were it not for your help, I should fail.
ko: 네 도움이 없었으면 난 실패했을 거야.

en: We cannot thank you too much for your help.
ko: 도와준 거 진짜 아무리 고맙다고 해도 모자라.

en: Your help prevented me from being ruined.
ko: 네 도움 덕분에 망하는 거 면했어.

en: Without your support, we probably won't be able to put this plan into practice.
ko: 네 지원 없이는 이 계획 실행하기 힘들 거야.

en: Without your aid, I couldn't have succeeded.
ko: 네 도움 없었으면 성공 못 했을 거야.

en: Without your help, I would have failed.
ko: 네 도움이 아니었으면 난 실패했을 거야.

en: Had it not been for your help, I could not have done it.
ko: 네 도움이 없었다면 이거 못 했을 거야.

en: Without your help, I couldn't have finished the work.
ko: 네 도움 없었으면 일 못 끝냈을 거야.

en: Your English composition leaves almost nothing to be desired.
Your English is too good to be in this class.
ko: 네 영어 실력은 이 반에 있기엔 너무 좋아.

en: Your English leaves much to be desired.
ko: 네 영어는 아직 부족한 게 많아.

en: Let me take a look at your driver's license.
I've heard about you.
Who is your favorite TV star?
How tall is your youngest brother?
I'll send you your clothes and some other things next month by express delivery.
ko: 다음 달에 네 옷이랑 다른 것들 택배로 보낼게.

en: Please don't limit your opinions just to 'Yes' or 'No'.
ko: 네 의견을 그냥 '응'이나 '아니'로만 한정 짓지 마.

en: Your opinion sounds like a good idea.
ko: 네 의견 좋은 생각인 것 같아.

en: How does your opinion differ from his?
ko: 네 의견이랑 그 사람 의견이랑 뭐가 달라?

en: Your opinion seems to be out of date.
ko: 네 생각은 좀 구식인 것 같아.

en: Your opinion is quite different from mine.
ko: 네 생각은 내 생각이랑 많이 달라.

en: Your idea runs counter to our policy.
ko: 네 아이디어는 우리 방침이랑은 좀 안 맞아.

en: Your idea has no foundation at all.
Your ideas sound crazy.
ko: 네 아이디어들 진짜 말도 안 돼.

en: Your opinions are right in a way.
What's your opinion?
I am for your opinion.
They will give way to you if your opinion is reasonable.
ko: 네 의견이 타당하면 그 사람들도 양보할 거야.

en: But for your steady support, my mission would have resulted in failure.
ko: 네 꾸준한 지원이 없었다면 내 임무는 실패했을 거야.

en: I would like to use your word processor.
Your robot will prepare meals, clean, wash dishes, and perform other household tasks.
ko: 네 로봇이 요리, 청소, 설거지 같은 집안일을 다 해줄 거야.

en: Do you think you could lend me some of your records?
ko: 네 레코드판 좀 빌려줄 수 있어?

en: Take a fresh look at your lifestyle.
ko: 네 생활 방식을 한번 새롭게 돌아봐.

en: I want to be a good player like you.
ko: 나도 너처럼 멋진 선수가 되고 싶어.

en: I wish I could speak English like you.
I wish I had a friend like you.
Because a man whose manners are as bad as yours must try everyone's patience.
ko: 너처럼 예의 없는 사람은 모두의 인내심을 시험하니까.

en: Devote your whole attention to your duties.
ko: 네가 맡은 일에 온 신경을 집중해.

en: Give your whole attention to what you are doing.
ko: 네가 지금 하고 있는 일에 집중해.

en: I want you to live more like a human being.
ko: 네가 좀 더 사람답게 살았으면 좋겠어.

en: You can have any picture that you want.
ko: 네가 원하는 사진은 아무거나 가져도 돼.

en: Your boyfriend got tired of waiting for you and left just now.
ko: 네 남자친구가 기다리다 지쳐서 방금 갔어.

en: I would like to be your pen pal.
ko: 나 네 펜팔 친구가 되고 싶어.

en: Which is your pen?
Yours is a very strange story.
Yours is over there.
I was anxious to read your letter from Paris.
ko: 파리에서 온 네 편지를 정말 빨리 읽고 싶었어.

en: Please allow me to carry your bag.
Your personal computer is identical with mine.
If it had not been for your foolishness, we would never have been in that trouble.
ko: 네 어리석음만 아니었어도 우리가 그런 곤경에 처하지는 않았을 거야.

en: Please show me your notebook.
I will be happy to attend your party.
Have your roses come out yet?
When do you plan to check out?
Your team is very good, but theirs is the best.
ko: 너희 팀도 잘하지만 저쪽 팀이 최고야.

en: Who is your dance partner?
I will find you your lost ring.
I painted a picture for you.
I've ordered you some dessert.
I think I should do it for you.
ko: 내가 널 위해 그걸 해줘야 할 것 같아.

en: Let me get you a ticket to the concert.
Shall I get some for you?
I asked Mom to get some for you.
ko: 엄마한테 네 것도 좀 챙겨달라고 했어.

en: I am quite willing to do anything for you.
ko: 널 위해서라면 뭐든지 기꺼이 할 수 있어.

en: Your account of the accident corresponds with the driver's.
ko: 네 사고 설명이 운전자의 설명이랑 일치해.

en: Your speech was appropriate for the occasion.
ko: 네 연설은 그 자리에 딱 적절했어.

en: What's your score?
Choose a dress you like.
Place your skis in an inverted V.
Your skirt is out of fashion.
Your shirts need to be washed.
Do whatever you want.
I like your sarong style skirt.
May I have a signature?
Your site appeals to people who are interested in cats.
ko: 고양이에 관심 있는 사람들한테 인기 많을 사이트네요.

en: I hope that your parents will allow us to marry.
ko: 부모님이 우리 결혼 허락해 주셨으면 좋겠어요.

en: Please do the work at your own convenience.
Your order is ready.
I rejoice in your success.
May this letter find you well and happy!
ko: 이 편지가 도착할 때쯤 건강하고 행복하시길 빌어요!

en: Your kindness really touches me.
I greatly appreciate your kindness.
We'll never forget your kindness.
ko: 친절하게 대해주신 거 절대 잊지 않을게요.

en: I appreciate your invitation, but...
I am very thankful to you for your advice.
Is your husband a picky eater?
I am very happy to hear about your engagement.
How are your studies going?
We know we may count on your cooperation.
I am in full accord with your view.
I think your favourite actress is in it.
ko: 좋아하는 여배우가 거기 나오는 것 같아요.

en: Where did you get this photo taken?
I can't think of you as more than a friend.
What should I call you?
I don't mean you.
I'll never forget you.
I didn't quite catch your words.
I hope and I know you did great!
ko: 잘했을 거라고 믿어요, 분명 잘 됐을 거예요!

en: I am quite pleased with you.
How many boys are there in your class?
How many pupils are there in your class?
Your colorful shirt really stands out.
Your bag is on my desk.
That sounds very interesting.
Do you mind my sitting next to you?
I am afraid I can't help you.
I'll be very happy if I can serve you.
ko: 도움이 될 수 있다면 정말 기쁘겠어요.

en: Could you spell your name, please?
What's your name and flight number?
Can your mother drive a car?
Your mother is trying to break up our marriage.
Your mother will be back before long.
Your mother will get well soon.
Is your mother at home now?
How is your mother?
Your mother is very young, isn't she?
Please give my best regards to your mother.
Were your mother and father home?
